properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 9 at 2:06PM PST until February 11 at 4:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Plan on difficult travel
conditions, including during the morning commute on Monday.
Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Total snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 inches between 3500 to 4500 feet, 3 to
6 inches between 4500 to 5500 feet, and 7 to 14 inches above
5500 feet.

* WHERE...The San Bernardino Mountains, especially the Big Bear
area.

* WHEN...Through 4 AM Tuesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will also be strong out of the
north to northeast Monday and Monday night, with gusts up to
50 mph at times. Be prepared for significant reductions in
visibility at times. Busy roadways will be impacted with
snowfall, including Cajon Pass.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions are occurring. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency.

For road condition information in California...enter
8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or
9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET
